title: Compositionally in Neural Networks
blurb: PhD student Michael Lepori discusses new approaches to studying compositionality in neural network models in a recent Carney Community Spotlight.

title: Finding the art in artificial intelligence
blurb: When design and neural networks mix the results are both practical and innovative.

title: Brown researchers teach computers to see optical illusions
blurb: By making a neural-network computer model that can be fooled by optical illusions like humans, the researchers advanced knowledge of the human visual system and may help improve artificial vision.

title: Research identifies key weakness in modern computer vision systems
blurb: In a finding that could point the way toward better computer vision systems, Brown University researchers show why computers are so bad at seeing when one thing is not like another.

title: Focus on early stage of illness may be key to treating ALS, study suggests
blurb: Many inhibitory neurons were lost early in the development of ALS, new research shows, which is in sharp contrast to other degenerative diseases.

title: University conference explores future of artificial intelligence
blurb: Interdisciplinary workshop brings together professors, students from diverse academic fields
